artifact.title: Artifact
artifact.description: A piece of data that is used or produced in a software development process, or by the deployment and operation of an IT system, such as a source file, executable, script, or configuration file.

artifactType.description: Data artifact category, per ArchiMate 3.2 Artifact element.

communicationnetwork.title: CommunicationNetwork
communicationnetwork.description: A set of structures that connects nodes for the purpose of transmission, routing, and reception of data, such as a LAN, WAN, or VPN.

networkType.description: Topology and scope classification of the network, per ArchiMate 3.2 CommunicationNetwork element.

device.title: Device
device.description: A physical IT resource upon which system software and artifacts may be stored or deployed for execution, such as a server, workstation, mobile device, or IoT sensor.

deviceType.description: Physical hardware category of the device, per ArchiMate 3.2 Technology Layer device classification.

node.title: Node
node.description: A computational or physical resource that hosts, manipulates, or interacts with other computational or physical resources, such as a server cluster, virtual machine host, or container runtime.

nodeType.description: Computational resource category of the node, per ArchiMate 3.2 Node element.

path.title: Path
path.description: A link between two or more nodes through which those nodes can exchange data, representing a logical communication channel such as a network route, API connection, or message channel.

pathType.description: Transmission topology of the path, per ArchiMate 3.2 Path element.

protocol.description: Communication protocol carried by this path.

systemsoftware.title: SystemSoftware
systemsoftware.description: Software that provides or contributes to an environment for storing, executing, and using other software or data deployed within it, such as an operating system, container runtime, database engine, or middleware platform.

softwareType.description: Platform software category, per ArchiMate 3.2 SystemSoftware element.

technologycollaboration.title: TechnologyCollaboration
technologycollaboration.description: An aggregate of two or more technology active structure elements that work together to perform collective technology behavior, such as a cluster of servers, a distributed cache, or a microservice mesh.

technologyevent.title: TechnologyEvent
technologyevent.description: A technology behavior element that denotes a state change in the technology layer that triggers or results from technology behavior, such as a system alert, infrastructure notification, scheduled job trigger, or deployment completion signal.

eventType.description: Technology state change category, per ArchiMate 3.2 Technology Event element; aligned with OpenTelemetry event semantics.

technologyfunction.title: TechnologyFunction
technologyfunction.description: A collection of technology behavior that can be performed by a node, representing an internal automated capability such as data replication, load balancing, or log rotation.

technologyinteraction.title: TechnologyInteraction
technologyinteraction.description: A unit of collective technology behavior performed by two or more collaborating nodes, such as a distributed transaction, inter-service handshake, or cluster failover protocol.

technologyinterface.title: TechnologyInterface
technologyinterface.description: Point of access where technology services are available

protocol.description: Communication protocol exposed at this interface, per ArchiMate 3.2 TechnologyInterface element.

technologyprocess.title: TechnologyProcess
technologyprocess.description: A sequence of technology behaviors that achieves a specific technology result, such as a deployment pipeline, backup job, certificate renewal workflow, or container orchestration sequence.

technologyservice.title: TechnologyService
technologyservice.description: Externally visible unit of technology functionality

serviceType.description: Infrastructure service category, aligned with cloud provider service classifications (IaaS/PaaS/SaaS) per ArchiMate 3.2 TechnologyService.
